stories.story_name: Refactor ProcureSight Site Tab Search Functionality
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user is on the ProcureSight Site tab **WHEN**: They enter a search term and click search **THEN**: The system uses the new backend API and displays results using the Procurement results interface

stories.story_name: Implement Procurement Summary View with Navigation Links
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user clicks on a procurement result card **WHEN**: The procurement summary loads **THEN**: All procurement data displays with clickable links to Vendor Summary and Codes Summary

stories.story_name: Add Save to Requirement and Collection Actions
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user views procurement search results **WHEN**: They click 'Add to Collection' or 'Save to Requirement' **THEN**: The procurement is saved to the selected destination and confirmation is displayed

stories.story_name: Restructure Requirement Summary Insights Tab Navigation
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user accesses the Requirement Summary **WHEN**: They view the Insights section **THEN**: The tab is renamed to 'Research' with separate Search, Bookmarks, Documents, and Best in Class tabs

stories.story_name: Implement Native AI Document Chat Feature
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user clicks on a document from search results **WHEN**: The document opens **THEN**: The Native AI Chat interface is available for document interaction

stories.story_name: Update Collections Grid and Summary Page UX
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user navigates to the Collections tab **WHEN**: They view collections **THEN**: The updated UX displays with Bookmarks, Documents, and Insights tabs in the collection summary

stories.story_name: Integrate Global Search Page with Recent Searches
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user accesses the Search tab in Requirement Summary **WHEN**: The page loads **THEN**: The Global search interface displays with recent searches shown below the search bar
**GIVEN**: A user has saved procurements to a requirement **WHEN**: They access the Bookmarks tab **THEN**: All saved procurements display with options to view details or remove from requirement
